text: [Music]
hello fellow travelers mark here with
wolters world and today we are here in
los angeles and today what i want to
talk about are some safety tips about
visiting la because i know when i did my
research on la that was one of the
biggest questions that came up is it
safe to visit there because when you see
all the movies and all the tv shows you
think it's just crime ridden all kinds
of horrible stuff well there are issues
when you come here but as a tourist i'll
be honest la is a relatively safe city
for tourists and tourist areas okay and
what i want to do is kind of go through
some of the safety tips i have for you
when you come to la so you can have a
nice safe experience whether you're
going to rodeo drive to see the shops or
hitting the beaches here or just
enjoying some of the great museums okay
and the first thing i think you really
need to realize is there is a lot of
homeless people here in la all over it's
not just on skid row it's not just
downtown it is all over here on the
beaches if you're going to be in town
outside of some hotels outside of some
restaurants you will see homeless people
when you're here and for the most part
they leave everybody alone but what you
do need to be careful is if you're going
to be giving them things or giving them
money or giving them food that's fine
but the thing is mental illness and drug
abuse has driven some of these people to
be homeless and so there can be issues
with that so just be smart when you are
around the homeless when you are here
you know don't go to the encampment
stone you know you'll see parks that are
full of tents that's not for you that's
where they live so as a tourist i
recommend kind of staying away or it's
keeping your distance from the homeless
when you are here so one of the things
you actually really have to think about
yeah because there's you see there's a
homeless guy right now harassing me from
behind so there's that now another
safety thing which i think a lot of
people kind of think of when i think of
la is the smog well i'll be honest with
you clean air policies here in la have
really cleared up the smog problem it's
not every day all the time however i
will say this if you're here in the
summer it can be an issue okay so if
you've got breathing problems you're
thinking to come maybe come in the
winter or the fall or the spring instead
of the summer to avoid the air quality
issues now another safety thing i think
is kind of important is when you're
going around town whether you're you
know on venice beach or you're going to
be you know on a hollywood walk of fame
you're going to see a lot of buskers
you're going to see a lot of street
performers and they're going to want
money if you take a picture of them now
you say well mark that's not a safety
issue well it's not but i will warn you
if you do take pictures of them and you
do not you know tip them like about two
three four five bucks whatever
they may harass you and they may follow
you around asking for money so you do
want to be careful with that so if you
are going to take pictures of the street
performers make sure your tip of them so
they get they get their stuff and they
leave you alone afterwards now this is
california and some people get a little
worried about coming here because they
think the earthquakes are going to hit
any minute now
no no earthquake today but there are
earthquakes that do happen when you're
here but i think
unless it's the big one you're probably
going to be okay if there is one because
of all the building regulations that are
here the buildings are not gonna fall
over on you so you should be okay all
right so don't worry if there's a little
bit of shake you'll notice the locals
kind of plan for that by pushing the the
nice items towards the back of the
shelves and the stores of the back of
the shows in their homes but honestly
it's not something you have to worry
about too much but it is something that
does happen occasionally so i wanted to
be ready for that now another safety
thing and one of the most annoying
things about when you come to l.a is the
traffic and there is a lot of safety
issues when it comes to traffic and
driving and crossing the street when you
are here um i know people will say don't
jaywalk well the thing with jaywalking
here it's not you're worried about the
cops getting you so much it's more you
worried about people flying through the
lights and just taking people out okay
like you got to be careful so even it
says walk make sure you're still looking
to make sure someone is in
zipping by uh through a red or through a
yellow okay so be careful with that if
you're driving around and you'll get
stuck in traffic it's just the way it is
if you're one of those people that says
oh i'm going to hop in the shoulder and
go around
don't forget to look back because
there's other people that are doing that
and they just fly down and you'll see a
ton of accidents on the road because of
that all right so do be careful and the
thing is road rage yeah that's a
california thing i think it was invented
here in l.a but it is something you do
need to be careful with that's why
always give yourself plenty of time when
you can be traveling anywhere by car so
you're not in a rush you're not getting
frustrated because you're going to get
frustrated anyway with the traffic it's
it's all day all night it's just all the
time so just be ready for it and when
you are driving around i think another
safety thing i should mention is make
sure you know the neighborhoods and know
the way you're gonna go you'll have your
gps set up get it with your rental or
have it on your car have those things
but just know there's neighborhoods
around la that you don't go to and the
reason why i say it's for tourists it's
pretty safe because you're not going to
those areas as a tourist so if you're
going to be driving you're thinking i'm
just going to hop off the highway i want
to hop off the 405 and go here well you
want to make sure you know where you're
hopping off and where you're not hopping
off what i've found is when i've talked
to the concierges in the front desk
they'll tell us you know hey you know
take this way don't get off here they
give us ideas where not to go they won't
tell you like in an email they won't
tell you over the phone but they will
tell you in person so that's one thing
you might want to ask about now another
thing is if you come to la you're
probably going to come to beaches like
this we're here at venice beach and
there are some safety things when you
are here um i will say obviously sun
protection is a very big thing here all
year round make sure i've got my
sunblock on it might not look like it
but i have my sunblock on have your
sunglasses hat these kind of things will
make an impact even if you're walking
around not on the beach but in town
because the sun can be pretty intense
when you're here and when you're going
to be swimming or you're going to go
swimming you'll see there's waves out
there you do want to be careful but also
i think it's important the coldness of
the water might surprise some people so
that could be a safety thing if you
think it's going to run in like
it can be cold okay so if you're going
to be doing like a surf less and you're
going to go out there rent the
rent the wetsuit as well to keep
yourself warm while you're in the water
now la is just like any other big city
you do need to take the usual travel
precautions you know you're not leaving
anything value in your car right you're
not you know flashing money out when
you're traveling around you know i mean
there are pickpockets sometimes here in
some of the more touristy areas you need
to pay attention for but in general it's
the usual travel sets no matter where
you go in the world don't think that
magic fanny pack is going to protect you
here in l.a you got to make sure you're
being smart with your travels and and i
think another thing i want to mention
about la is every time there's rain
people freak out
like i was on listen to the news and
they had .1 inches of rain and it was
like the end of the world according to
the the weather person okay and i'm like
that seems a little crazy but the thing
is here there's all this cement and that
water can just start going you can see
that with the runoff and how the water
is it can get a little scary there with
the water all the sun out of nowhere
filling up some of these ravines and
filling up some of these side roads but
also for the people since they don't
know how to drive the rain sometimes
they get a little freaked out by it so
do have a heads up for that because it
might not be hard for you to drive in
the rain but since the people you're
driving with might have issues you
should take care with that and i think
another thing is a tourist when you come
here um you know the forest fires
wildfires that do hit california every
year um that might be something to look
into if you're going to be coming here
during that time because that can affect
air quality but also it affects people's
homes and and where you can go so you do
want to make sure you're
keeping abreast of anything up here when
that's going on all right so overall my
time here i have not felt uncomfortable
except with a few uh instances with some
homeless guys when we were here like i
was filming here and a guy was taking a
piss right behind the camera and yelling
at me so that was a little odd but uh
otherwise it hasn't been too bad so if
you want to learn more we got plenty
stuff on la bye
